definitions.definition: The (usually benevolent ) being that created the universe out of primal matter .
examples: A demiurge or craftsman god takes pre-existing matter and fashions it in light of the eternal Forms.

definitions.definition: A (usually jealous or outright malevolent ) being who is inferior to the supreme being, and sometimes seen as the creator of evil .
Something (such as an idea , individual or institution ) conceived as an autonomous creative force or decisive power .
The title of a magistrate in a number of states of Ancient Greece , and in the city states ( poleis ) of the Achaean League .

main_definition: ( Platonic philosophy ) The (usually benevolent ) being that created the universe out of primal matter .
secondary_definitions: ( Gnosticism ) A (usually jealous or outright malevolent ) being who is inferior to the supreme being, and sometimes seen as the creator of evil .
( figuratively ) Something (such as an idea , individual or institution ) conceived as an autonomous creative force or decisive power .
( historical , Ancient Greece ) The title of a magistrate in a number of states of Ancient Greece , and in the city states ( poleis ) of the Achaean League .
